intro: Moussonia adpressipilosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved moussonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple, arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
